Package gui_code

Class IslandWindow

java.lang.Object
gui_code.IslandWindow
public class IslandWindow
extends java.lang.Object
The window to represent an island that the player is on
Author:
nzoli

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Island currentIsland
    The island that the window is representing.
    private javax.swing.JFrame frame
    The current frame/window Automatically generated by WindowBuidler
    private java.lang.String isleName
    String representation of the island's name for the text field.
    private UiManager manager
    The manager instance that controls inter-window cohesion
    private java.lang.String munCount
    String representation of the current money count for the money text field.
    private Ship ship
    The player's ship Here for easier access of location and endurance data
    private java.lang.String timeCount
    String representation of the time left for the time text field.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    IslandWindow()
    Create the application.
    IslandWindow​(UiManager incomingManager, Island incomingIsland)
    Modified constructor that is used in the manager

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void closeWindow()
    Closes the window
    private void getGameDetails()
    Gets the details for the game's text fields, such as money and time count, as well as island name.
    void goShopping()
    Tells the manager to go to the Buy things window
    private void initialize()
    Initialize the contents of the frame.
    void inspectShip()
    Tells the manager to go to the view ship window
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
    Launch the application.
    void sellThings()
    Tells the manager to go to the Sell things window
    void settingSail()
    Tells the manager to go to the destination/route selection window
    void viewIslands()
    Tells the manager to go to the island viewing window

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • frame

      private javax.swing.JFrame frame
      The current frame/window Automatically generated by WindowBuidler

    • currentIsland

      private Island currentIsland
      The island that the window is representing. This matters for things like displaying the name, as well as giving other windows (like the shops) the correct island information

    • manager

      private UiManager manager
      The manager instance that controls inter-window cohesion

    • ship

      private Ship ship
      The player's ship Here for easier access of location and endurance data

    • isleName

      private java.lang.String isleName
      String representation of the island's name for the text field.

    • munCount

      private java.lang.String munCount
      String representation of the current money count for the money text field.

    • timeCount

      private java.lang.String timeCount
      String representation of the time left for the time text field.

  • Constructor Details

    • IslandWindow

      public IslandWindow()
      Create the application.

    • IslandWindow

      public IslandWindow​(UiManager incomingManager, Island incomingIsland)
      Modified constructor that is used in the manager
      Parameters:
      incomingManager - The UiManager instance that will be managing this window
      incomingIsland - The Island object that this will be representing

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Launch the application.
      Parameters:
      args - Stores the Java command line arguments

    • getGameDetails

      private void getGameDetails()
      Gets the details for the game's text fields, such as money and time count, as well as island name.

    • closeWindow

      public void closeWindow()
      Closes the window

    • inspectShip

      public void inspectShip()
      Tells the manager to go to the view ship window

    • settingSail

      public void settingSail()
      Tells the manager to go to the destination/route selection window

    • viewIslands

      public void viewIslands()
      Tells the manager to go to the island viewing window

    • goShopping

      public void goShopping()
      Tells the manager to go to the Buy things window

    • sellThings

      public void sellThings()
      Tells the manager to go to the Sell things window

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      Initialize the contents of the frame. If it cannot get island parameters, then it will initialize with default names.
